Oh wow. That's a great idea. A redditor mentioned something about custom cards in Google Now using xposed, and I'd love to see a card with recently defined words with the option to "add to flash cards".
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DwzDqN7foyI feature=youtube_gdata_player
Because of the thumbnail I thought this was from /r/crossview. I decided to try it out cross-eyed anyways and it's magnificent.

Not 100% sure, but I think Xblast Tools had this option. http://forum.xda-developers.com/showthread.php?t=2294419
If really enjoy this module be sure to support the developer and buy the paid version on Google Play. https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=ind.fem.black.xposed.mods
What app are you using for your writing? My best advice is to backup everything online.
Could changing the DPI with a custom rom help? Using Miracast to mirror wirelessly would probably be more convenient, but it is hard to find a cheap Miracast adapter.
I called it an ocrothrope for a while until recently.

I'll be using this modification when my [NFC Ring](http://www.kickstarter.com/projects/mclear/nfc-ring) arrives to turn on the screen when I hold my phone, and to lock it when it leaves my hand. I've added other tasks to let me change hands without locking the screen and configuring the PIN unlock depending on whether or not I'm connected to my home WIFI.
A taglost sound feature was recently added, but I'm hoping for the ability to be silent altogether because of how often I'll be using it. After using this module for a few weeks, and enabling NFC even when the screen is off (Don't forget to disable Google Wallet if you do this!) I still haven't noticed a difference in battery life.
Edit: Article and video demonstration: http://www.nfcbrief.com/2013/03/modification-adds-nfc-tag-removal.html

WRITING.TITLE: [Request] 4.3 fix.
WRITING.TEXT:
I'm not very experienced with Tasker.
Netflix and Snapchat cause my phone to turn off if they're not swiped away in recents. It's a known issue caused by the 4.3 update that needs to be fixed by the app developers.
I want automatically kill the apps when I leave them.
Nexus 4 stock unrooted 4.3
http://tasker.wikidot.com/weather-dependent-background-image Not specifically for http get, but it's covered here.

I don't hear people talk about this feature very often, but it's one of the main reasons I bought the Nexus 4.
Not only does the micro usb double as a slimport hdmi, but it also acts as an antenna extension. Your entire room, or your entire house might be acting as an antenna when you plug your phone in, depending on how your house is wired.
Right now the only other phone with this feature is the xperia Z. If you want even better signal plug in some headphones too.
None of this is true but if this was a feature I would be so happy.
TLDR: idk

If your phone is connected to the same network as your PlayStation the cast option should appear if you have the app open in both devices. Hopefully the Netflix PS3 app will be updated with this feature.
Edit: We did it Reddit! Netflix supports casting just like YouTube on the PS3.
It's like getting a new phone:)
I think they should.

Are you talking about the "non - golfers" thing? Atheists getting together to discuss how much they don't believe in God seems weird to me too, but the article talks about the camp being focused on science and critical thinking.

I'm not sure about multiple displays, but [this](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.liveov.skm) app allows you to use your Android device as an extension for your pc. I've used it for a while now and it works well.
http://www.reddit.com/domain/play.google.com/
